title: Huge 'part wild' 4ft cat roaming Bristol with public urged not to approach
text:

A huge 'part wild' Savannah cat is roaming the streets of Bristol, with its owner urging the public to keep their distance.

Laura Page is warning locals not to approach the Savannah, a hybrid breed between a several African wildcat and a domestic mog, over fears they may scare it away.

Instead, she wants anyone who spots the 4ft cat to call her so she can catch it with a trap she has borrowed, Bristol Live reports.

The much-loved pet cat, which is as big as a medium-sized dog, managed to escape from its special enclosure almost two days ago.

(Image: Laura Page)

The missing cat weighs in at more than 25lb and from nose to the tip of his tail is almost 4ft long.

Laura said that he is not a danger, and is scared of humans, but should not be approached as he will run off.

She urged that sightings of him should be texted to her.

(Image: Laura Page)

The cat has a blue collar on with her mobile phone and email on, and he is chipped, but to an address in the USA.

“He is a Savannah cat, he’s part wild and will be afraid of people and loud noises,” she said.

“Please don’t approach him or try to catch or coax him in - he’s fast. He has a loud pitched meow, which is very distinctive,” she added.

(Image: Getty Images/Dorling Kindersley)

Bristol’s cat and dog owner community is rallying around the family, and Laura has been lent a trap which she hopes to use to catch her beloved cat.

“He will run if people approach him, so I just want anyone who sees him to contact me, and not try to get him,” she added.

If anyone sees this distinctive cat, they should text Laura on 07983 852889.

Savannah cats are the largest domestic cats in the world.
description: Laura Page plans to capture her missing Savannah cat with a giant trap but people must 'keep their distance'
